page.title: 03*** S.HETTON COLLIERY ***
page.content: The colliery was formed in 1831 with the sinking of two shafts,the first coal being 'won' in 1833. Production boomed in the late nineteenth century and the village expanded considerably as a result.The peak of coal production was reached in the early 1950's The recent contractions in the coal industry have had their effect in the area and the colliery has slowly been phased out of production, the last coal being taken from the pit in 1982. The shaft and winding gear remain operative as an emergency entrance to the local workings and for safety work to take place. Local miners have been moved to jobs in other pits within the local district.
